channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Unclear road markings, 12th February
item.description:
Approaching the racecourse roundabout along Evesham Rd with the racecourse on the left additional road markings/lane signage is needed. The left lane is marked as left turn only which suggests it is only for use taking the racecourse exit. The right lane is marked as ahead & right which suggests it’s for traffic taking all other exits including new barn lane. The majority of traffic taking the new barn lane exit uses the left lane meaning the block the traffic in the correct right hand lane. Left lane needs to be marked racecourse only or an additional sign on approach to the roundabout is needed confirming which lane is for which exits. The current ambiguous road markings/lack of lane signage are highly likely to cause a serious accident if they’re not clarified.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bentham Lane sign, 12th February
item.description:
The Betham Lane sign has again been knocked by a vehicle and is pointing along the A46 to Cheltenham. Lorries are turning to Little Shurdington and then trying to use Dark Lane and getting stuck The sign needs setting back from the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elm Cottage Shurdington Road, Bentham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road signs, 12th February
item.description:
The sign that should be on the Cheltenham bound side of the road between Church Lane and Bentham lane warning you are approaching the Bentham Lane turning is missing. I have previously been notified this is being replaced, but nothing has happened
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elm Cottage Shurdington Road, Bentham

item.title: Chasm of a pothole,(one of many) Robert Burns Avenue, 8th February
item.description:
A "chasm" of a pothole that is an accident risk to cyclists and motorcyclists and a damage risk to cars is getting bigger by the day. This is adjacent to the speed hump between Colesbourne Road and the entrance to St Mark's Junior School. This is just one of many that are opening up yet again along the whole length of Robert Burns Avenue. There are better road surfaces in many third world countries caused purely by a lack of maintenance and sub-standard previous repairs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 65 Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing bollard, 7th February
item.description:
Safety bollard has been hot by a car and removed. Leaving an island jutting out into the road which is unmarked. Serious risk for cyclists and cars at night and poor light.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Pittville Circus Road, Cheltenham
